definition: to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Sometimes story, take on the piano chords try.
sentences.chinese: 有時也煞有介事，拿着簡譜在鋼琴上摩拳擦掌。

sentences.english: What is life?" he asks, rhetorically in the introduction.
sentences.chinese: 什麼是生命？“他在介紹部分煞有介事地問。

sentences.english: They can make impossible things seem possible.
sentences.chinese: 他們能將不可能的事製作的煞有介事”。

sentences.english: And if he doesn’t argue against it, why has he bothered to write this book?
sentences.chinese: 既然不反對，爲何他又要如此煞有介事地寫這本書呢？

definition: see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to seize the opportune moment/to lose no time
